VPR.Q: What is the overall spatial distribution pattern shown in the heatmap?
VPR.A: The heatmap shows a {radial gradient} pattern.

EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.93}.

EVJ.Q: What is the global minimum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global minimum heat value is {0.10}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value for label Weather Impact on the y-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value for Weather Impact on the y-axis is {0.92}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Water Usage on the x-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value of Water Usage on the x-axis is {0.93}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Pest Control on the x-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Pest Control on the x-axis is {0.70}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Crops on the x-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Crops on the x-axis is {0.40}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Livestock and Quality or the cell corresponding to Poultry and Yield?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Poultry} and {Yield} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Livestock and Labor or the cell corresponding to Poultry and Weather Impact?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Poultry} and {Weather Impact} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Poultry and Demand or the cell corresponding to Livestock and Technology Adoption?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Livestock} and {Technology Adoption} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.13 to 0.30?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Farm Management, Cost), (Farming Techniques, Cost), (Crops, Demand), (Crops, Labor)}.
